xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: A natural person, a legal person or a system.
An electronic process that enables the electronic identification of a natural or legal person, or the origin and integrity of data in electronic form to be confirmed.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: See Article 3, Definitions, of the eIDAS Regulation.

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: An electronic process that enables an agent to access and use a system after checking that the agent, or the one represented by the agent, has the right to use it.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: eAuthorisation occurs after previous eIdentification and eAuthentication in that system. Agents that are authorised can be natural persons or systems. Agents that act on behalf of a natural or legal persons may need a mandate.

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: A condition that needs to be answered to evaluate whether a user has the right to use a system.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: In the context of RPaM, eAuthorisation Criteria may contain a tuple composed of an Information Requirement and a Constraint used to evaluate the right of a mandatee to use a Service.Both the Information Requirement and the Constraint are optional elements.The answer to the criterion is normally expected from an authority, e.g. an offiicial Mandate Registry or Management System.
xsd:documentation.ccts:Source: Adapted from the definition of the Criterion by the Core Criterion and Evidence Vocabulary

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: A set of interrelated information representing the facts, data, or opinions, in any medium or form, including textual, numerical, graphic, cartographic, narrative, or audio-visual forms that the capability exchanges with other capabilities to support the execution of value streams.

Electronic identification means the process of using person identification data in electronic form uniquely representing either a natural or legal person, or a natural person representing a legal person.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: See Article 3, Definitions, of the eIDAS Regulation.

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: Data in electronic form which is attached to or logically associated with other data in electronic form and which is used by the signatory to sign.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: See Article 3, Definitions, of the eIDAS Regulation.

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: A body of persons or an entity (as a corporation) considered as having many of the rights and responsibilities of a natural person.
Record that describes the terms under which a mandator grants a representation power to a mandatee.
xsd:documentation.ccts:Source: REA, Registro Electr√≥nico de Apoderamientos, Spain

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: An agent that can act on behalf of another agent using a mandate.
An agent that grants one or more powers to another agent via a mandate.
A human being as distinguished from a person (as a corporation) created by operation of law.

xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: In the context of RPaM, the term "person" is used to refer to any type of person, i.e. natural or legal person.
This refers normally to the power of the person that "owns" the power, which in the context of RPaM this is the "represented person".

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: The capacity to act on behalf of a person.
An organisation, public or private, that provides an online service.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: In the context of RPaM these are normally public administrations online that rely on the information contained in a mandate issued by an authoritative Mandate Management System.

xsd:documentation.ccts:Definition: A repository of mandates that are accessible by electronic means.
xsd:documentation.ccts:AdditionalInformation: In the context of RPaM these are normally authoritative registries. Hence, in RPaM, we also call them "eMandate Registries".
